mapper.select: select u.user_id,u.username,u.loginname,u.password,u.rights as user_rights,r.role_id,r.role_name ,u.last_login,u.contact,u.phone,u.email,u.provincialid,u.city,u.countyid,u.address,u.post,u.tax,u.file,u.type from tb_user u left join tb_role r on u.role_id=r.role_id where 1=1

select u.user_id,u.username,u.loginname,u.password,u.rights,u.role_id,u.status,u.last_login,u.contact,u.phone,u.email,u.provincialid,u.cityid,u.countyid,u.address,u.post,u.tax,u.file,u.type, p.orgid proid,p.orgname proname,c.orgid cityid,c.orgname cityname,d.orgid countyid,d.orgname countyname from tb_user u left join organ p on u.provincialid = p.orgid and p.level = 1 and p.valid = 1 left join organ c on u.cityid = c.orgid and c.level = 2 and c.valid = 1 left join organ d on u.countyid = d.orgid and d.level = 3 and d.valid = 1 where u.user_id = #{userId}

select u.user_id,u.username,u.rights as user_rights,u.loginname,u.password,r.role_id,r.role_name,r.rights as role_rights ,u.contact,u.phone,u.email,u.provincialid,u.cityid,u.countyid,u.address,u.post,u.tax,u.file,u.type from tb_user u left join tb_role r on u.role_id=r.role_id where u.user_id=#{userId}
select count(user_id) from tb_user where loginname=#{loginname}
mapper.update: update tb_user set loginname=#{loginname}, username=#{username}, password=#{password}, rights=#{rights}, status=#{status}, role_id=#{roleId}, last_login=#{lastLogin} where user_id=#{userId}
update tb_user set last_login=#{lastLogin} where user_id=#{userId}
update tb_user set rights=#{rights} where user_id=#{userId}
update tb_user set status=#{status},role_id=#{roleId} where user_id=#{userId}
